phrases: What is the point of a building this big?
Eastern Federation Elkia Embassy
It is so funny how they are trying desperately
to compensate for their own weakness by building something so huge.
By the way, would you tell me why you suddenly dragged me here?
Hey!
The embassy is foreign soil!
I know.
I know it was originally our castle, too.
You are invading their territory.
Do not worry.
I made an appointment.
Right?
I am the assistant ambassador for the Eastern Federation's Elkia Embassy,
Ino Hatsuse.
A pleasure to meet you.
When did you
This morning.
He was looking at me
when I was in the library,
so I gestured to say I was on my way.
The Warbeasts' senses are as good as they say.
They have got great vision.
I was really surprised.
No, I mean...
You have come to see Izuna Hatsuse, the ambassador, yes?
The Warbeasts can read minds!
The rumors are true!
Glad we are on the same page.
Okay, take me there.
Very well.
This way.
I understand the Warbeasts, but how did Sora see him from...
The game's already...
The game's
already begun, has not it?
Fake End
Hey, Jibril.
Yes?
Do you know what this is?
Some sort of image display device...
But the Warbeasts do not use magic.
M-My interest is piqued!
Th-The floor is moving!
Sora-dono, I would appreciate it if you would follow
the proper procedures to make an appointment next time.
Following that incident, there are a number of Warbeasts
harboring extreme animosity towards Elkia.
I was unable to inform them before your arrival,
so some may be very rude to you.
Even a talking dog that walks upright is still a dog, I see.
Steph, what incident is he talking about?
The construction wars...
Having a foreign embassy bigger than our palace was bad for our image,
so we built a new one.
Oh, you mean the palace we live in.
After that, the Eastern Federation started to build
their embassy bigger, as if to spite us.
Elkia lags behind the Eastern Federation in construction technology...
Even without that,
the idea of the 14th ranked Warbeasts looking
down on the lowest ranked Imanity is like...
Oh, I have got the perfect phrase.
A pot calling a kettle black.
Very well said.
And quite harsh coming from a rank six.
So what does that make you,
as a defective weapon working with the hairless monkeys?
This world is pretty hostile, is not it?
It is nice to see you children so lively now that violence is forbidden.
After that war dragged on forever,
Unlike you antiques who retired since you were only good for killing things.
the ten pledges suddenly came along and forbid violence.
Of course some grudges remain.
How embarrassing.
Please wait here.
You can really see the difference in the sophistication of our cultures!
By the way, Master,
how did you make contact with the Warbeasts?
Nobody's talking about it.
Take the hint.
I am sorry.
Unlike those beasts who can read minds...
I want to know!
Oh?
You did not see him at all, but you guessed that he saw you,
and so you gestured.
Which means...
You bluffed someone who can read minds?
I apologize for the wait.
This is the Eastern Federation's ambassador to Elkia,
Izuna Hatsuse!
King Crimson!
Hey, pretty little girl with the animal ears!
Why do not you come play with me?
Do not worry, I am just a pervert.
Why the hell are you touching me, asshole?
Please.
-50 cuteness points...
Why the hell did you stop?
Please.
I was just surprised because you assholes
touched me out of nowhere.
Please.
Get back to it already.
Please.
Um... adding please to the end
of every sentence does not make it polite.
Please.
It does not?
Please.
Please do not be upset.
My granddaughter is still learning the Imanity language.
Also...
Keep your filthy hands off my sweet granddaughter, hairless monkey!
I will rip you in half!
Please refrain from any actions that would make me say that.
I see.
So that is where she gets it from.
I do not like him.
-1000 points.
But Izuna is so cute with her contrasting personalities!
+1050 points.
You hairless monkeys are better than my grandpa.
Keep at it, please.
Okay, why do not you stop calling us hairless monkeys?
I am Sora.
That is Shiro, my little sister.
Hi, Izuna-tan.
Got it.
Sora, Shiro.
Please.
Then let us hear what you damn monkeys have to say.
If you can read our thoughts, you do not need to hear us say it.
This is a place of diplomacy.
A place for exchanging words and documents.
Or is that too complicated for you monkeys?
Do not be mad just because we are better with your granddaughter than you.
So immature.
Master, try not to shatter the Warbeast's fragile, glass-like heart.
He is so pathetic, it makes me want to laugh I mean, cry!
Do you two have no propriety?!
Okay, I will tell you what we want, old man.
Play a game with me for your granddaughter's panties.
I will bet Steph's.
What?
If you want me to roll you up in a carpet and throw you out,
then just say so, you damn monkey!
You would rather have Jibril's than Steph's?
If that is your order, Master...
Menacing
Shiro's, then?
You want an 11-year-old's panties?
You are sick, old man.
Or do you want...
Nooo...
M-Mine?
I am not gay, though.
I will protect your chastity, Brother!
You sure, old man?
I would say giving up her panties is a good deal for you.
If you are not going to tell me what you are here for, then leave right
Would you drop that pathetic act?
If you can actually read thoughts, then go for the panty game.
It is not the panties you are after.
It is the chance to wipe my memories of how all your games work.
Here, shake my hand.
You got scared.
I was right, huh?
Cold reading.
It is a cheap trick that anybody can do
with a little bit of knowledge and some intuition,
even without the amazing senses that a Warbeast has.
Coincidentally, it is a specialty of mine.
He is...
You done confirming that it is not a bluff?
Well then,
now that we have confirmed that this mind-reading thing
is a load of bull, it is time for what you have been waiting for.
I will tell you what we came here for.
We, Sora and Shiro, designated representatives of the Imanity,
the rank 16 race, and the kingdom of Elkia...
with the opportunity to be the first step on our path to world domination.
We challenge you to a game between nations,
for everything the Eastern Federation has on this continent.
A game between nations?
We are attacking the Eastern Federation?
Is that what you just said?
Yup.
Oh, and we are not changing our bet.
It is still Steph's panties.
You should have bet Izuna's panties while you had the chance.
Too bad.
Sorry, old man.
Check.
M-Master, what is the meaning of this?
Jibril, you still do not understand?
We have got the Eastern Federation in check.
The Eastern Federation's technology rapidly advanced 50 years ago,
but it is hard being an advanced civilization on an island.
They needed lots of resources from the continent.
However, Elven Garde attacked before they could get a toehold on the continent.
The Eastern Federation lured them into it.
But nobody would agree to play a game that the
strongest nation had lost repeatedly,
which means they would never get the continent.
They should have deliberately lost and just paid the price.
Why did not they?
Let us solve these mysteries in turn.
Question 1!
Why do they wipe memories of the game?
Because if they do not, they will not be able to win every time.
Correct!
It contradicts the goal of luring others into playing.
Memories
Game: Rock-Paper-Scissors
The reason they wipe memories, even though it defies logic,
is because there is something they do not want anyone finding out.
But even if you erase their memories, the fact remains that they lost.
Question 2!
Why did Elven Garde challenge them four times?
Because they were trying to discover
what the game was from the fact that they lost.
Elven Garde's a big country, unlike Elkia.
They were prepared to suffer some losses to do their research.
Result: I do not remember, but I lost once
They lost once, so they decided it was a game where you cannot use magic.
Magical Ability: Elf > Warbeasts Near Zero ()
That is the most likely reason an elf would lose.
A game where you cannot use magic?
Some plan
I will win without magic!
So they challenged a second time, with some plan in mind.
And they lost again.
And then, the third time,
I do not know how, but they figured out the game.
They used those official cheats known as magic that you envy so much,
and finally made their fourth challenge.
And they lost anyway.
You have a very active imagination.
But the process by which they lost does not matter.
Why did they stop after four times?
It does not matter if the rest is just my imagination.
As for why they stopped...
There are two possibilities.
One: They realized the game was fundamentally impossible to win.
Eight: Being caught cheating during a game is grounds for an instant loss.
Then if they had exposed it during a fifth game, they would have won.
Two:
They figured out the game,
but they never figured out why they lost.
So they stopped challenging.
But...
Huh?
Huh?
That does not make sense.
You understand the game, but do not know why you lost?
A game that you understand, but do not know why you lost?
Now it is getting good!
Question 3!
What kind of game works against each one of these very different races,
Imanity Flugel Elf
but which only the technologically advanced Eastern Federation possesses?
The answer is...
Video Game
A video game where you can cheat all you want.
A video game?
What is that?
You do not know, do you?
But, Jibril, you challenged the Eastern Federation once before.
How come you would never seen that thing in the entrance before?
Huh?
That is because...
You would forgotten it.
Since it is a memory associated with the game.
Well, even without that,
if a Flugel like Jibril does not know about them,
it is safe to say that the only country in the world
with video games is the Eastern Federation.
That is why you erase memories to keep them a secret.
Because in a video game where you are the game master,
you can cheat all you want.
Your opponents have no way to figure it out.
If you do not know what cyberspace is, then magic does not help you.
That nonsense about reading minds is your way
of calling your cheats a sixth sense so opponents will not try to look closer.
That is right.
You can tell when someone is lying,
but you cannot read minds.
Okay, last question!
How did we figure all this out?
I will give this one to you, old man.
It could not be... the previous king!
We made him swear by the pledges not to tell anyone!
And he did not figure out that we could not read minds...
No, the problem is...
Yup.
That is not the problem.
The fact that the previous king was able to tell anyone anything
proves that you could not read his mind.
Because his pledge to tell no one for the rest of his life
did not include after he died, which made it a trap.
So, now that we know all about your game...
If we were to give this information to the elves,
you would soon be put in a position where you had to play a game,
and you would lose.
You need to erase our memories.
But if you are willing to bet territory for Steph's panties in a game,
that would mean my imagination is completely correct.
Yes, which means...
Which means
your only option is to claim I am making it all up and run away, huh?
Did you think we would let you get away?
All of Imanity.
I will bet my Race Piece.
K-Kurami, that is...
Fi, has there ever been a game where a Race Piece was bet?
O-Of course not!
If you bet your Race Piece and lose,
you lose all your rights as an Exceed, meaning...
The ten pledges no longer apply to you,
which means you are no better than animals.
It is a de facto death sentence.
Those bastards...
Are you insane?
I have bet our entire territory and the lives of every one of us.
If you run away now,
that would be telling the entire world that my imagination was correct.
Did you see that one coming, Mr. Mind Reader?
Checkmate.
Are you really sure about this?
Even if you are correct, Elven Garde still lost this game.
Plus, you are betting your Race Piece.
Do you want to go extinct?
If you would have just been surprised when I was able to communicate
with you from the library, you would have noticed...
that we are not from this world.
When it comes to video games,
you can use any cheats or tool assists you want.
Blank is not going to lose to any of those.
When we came here...
Did you think we were more easy prey?
It is your turn to be hunted, Warbeasts.
Who are these people?
Well, you cannot agree to play a game of this scale on your own, right?
We can hold it another day.
We are betting our Race Piece.
Every Imanity has the right to watch,
and we will compete with these four players.
W-Wait!
We will not let you refuse.
I am not sure I understand.
But
are you challenging me to a fight, Sora and Shiro?
A fight?
No way.
Izuna-tan, let us play a game next time!
I will not lose.
Sorry, but you will.
Blank never loses.
See you soon, Izuna-tan.
What were you thinking?!
Do you realize what you have done?
How are you going to take responsibility if you lose?
Responsibility?
If we lose, we are all screwed.
There is no responsibility to it.
If we lose, it is game over for us and three million people.
If we win, we get the animal girls and the territory.
All or nothing.
Is not it exciting, Shiro?
It is so exciting!
Y-You are mad!
Calm down, Steph.
It is a game.
I knew it!
It was wrong to entrust
these people with my grandfather's hopes!
Then I will ask you, Dola-chan.
If the masters win,
every Warbeast on the continent will be stripped of their rights
and possibly killed.
Who should take responsibility for that?
We rule each other and kill each other with games instead of violence.
If you lose, you are exploited, enslaved, and killed.
That is what the ten pledges mean.
The boldness needed to risk the lives of your people
as well as your own, even for an instant,
for a sure chance to slay your enemy...
That is what we need in a ruler.
Huh?
What are you talking about?
What?
Wait, you mean you guys have not figured it out?
The way to beat this world.
The way to beat this world?
That explains it.
No wonder God's so bored.
Poor Tet.
Do not worry, we will conquer the world just like we promised.
The whole thing.
And as for what we will do if we lose...
I told you there was no chance we would lose, did not I?
Checkmate!
Bring down the foolish king!
He is using us all in his stupid bet!
They are working with the Eastern Federation!
I knew something was off from the start!
There is no way an Imanity could beat an elf!
It is fascinating how quickly they have turned on you.
They have all received a death sentence.
Of course they are upset.
It is actually strange to be calm at a time like this.
What are you going to do about them?
If they do not like it,
they can take our position as representative from us.
Day 19
Hold
Let the people who do not have the guts to challenge us whine all they want.
Day 19
More importantly, they are late.
It is been a week.
You mean the Eastern Federation's naming of a date for the game?
A whole continent's at stake, so it is going to take time.
Yup.
So before that...
I am waiting for someone with more backbone.
They are finally here.
You kept me waiting too long.
Yeah, I know what you want.
Anytime is fine.
Shiro, listen to me carefully.
I believe in you.
I believe in you, too.
Shiro, the two of us are always one.
Shiro, we are bound by a promise.
Shiro, we are not the heroes of a boy's manga.
Shiro, we always win a game before we start.
Brother?
I am going to get the last piece we need to bring over the Eastern Federation.
Brother?
Brother, wait
Now, let us begin the game.
Brother?
Shiro?
It is morni Huh?
Wh-What is wrong, Shiro?
Brother... Come out, Brother.
Do not leave me alone...
Wh-Who is Brother?
Should I bring him?
Number of Contacts
No...
No!
Shiro?
What is wrong?
Steph...
Where is Brother...
Where is Sora?
Sora?
That is a name, right?
Who is that?
Sky Walk
I will not let go of your hand, Brother,
because I think you would take my soul with you.
